cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: continues northwest, crossing eastern-central Cuba tonight, emerging into the Florida Straits Monday night, then tracking northward just offshore the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend area and the southeast United States coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay / Big Bend region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch currently limited to the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Watch eastern and central Cuba; no U.S. coastal warnings yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, especially Keys, south and west coasts; heavy-rain/wind fringe impacts possible along southeast Florida coast including Port Everglades
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (NHC guidance 2–4" with isolated 6" over south FL)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (forecast 1–2 ft in Keys, lower along southeast FL Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (20–35 kt sustained, higher gusts) possible late Monday night through Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation up to 1–2 ft possible along exposed Atlantic inlets; significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Monday–Wednesday could total 2–4 inches with localized amounts near 6 inches causing urban ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and squalls could disrupt pilot boarding and container crane operations; lightning risk in convective bands
